intro: Ectadiopsis lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Due to its toxic properties, it is often avoided by livestock and humans.
